website_summaries.verdict: This universal phone mount fits both bicycles and motorcycles – everything but "crotch rockets," thanks to its wide, adjustable clamp.
pros: Fits almost any phone up to 3.5 inches wide
Adjusts to fit handlebars from 7/8 to 1 1/4 inches in diameter
Clamps on securely with a hard plastic grip using 2 points of contact
Silicone net helps keep phone attached
cons: Plastic fixture can break if you over-tighten the metal clamp
Will not fit super sport bike clip-on style handlebars

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my motorcycle. It's a custom bike and I use a cruise around at 80 to 90 miles an hour. One thing I love is the fact that it fits my handlebars because they're pretty big and they give you two different sizes for handlebars. They also give you multiple sizes for your phone. It's not only great to get extra pieces but they're also sturdy as hell. And then there's the fact that you know that your phone is secure or not going to blow off the bike especially when our phones cost 800 to $1,200
customer_reviews.author: Dion White

customer_reviews.title: You have found the best, read my comments to see why
customer_reviews.text: I have this on my BMW motorcycle. If you are looking for the best, this is the one. This is my second one as the other ones shown on Amazon do NOT have the thumbs screw to tighten on the bar. This phone mount is easy to install no tools required like the other brands. Plus I got three rubbers in the box, in case one breaks to hold the phone, this set-up will last for years. My other one I purchased from a different vendor broke, hence I needed a replacement, this is THE ONE> and no I do not work for this company I am a real Amazon customer.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Freeman

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Holds incredibly well
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! Holds incredibly well! Here is a video of my husband doing 95 mph while the iphone 7+ is on the holder.
customer_reviews.author: NamiesBooks

customer_reviews.title: ... was delivered on time and the phone mount worked great on my recumbent trike
customer_reviews.text: Order was delivered on time and the phone mount worked great on my recumbent trike. I hit some big bumps but the mount held the phone steady. This mount is a great value for the price AND has great performance!
customer_reviews.author: L.K.

customer_reviews.title: Not made well
customer_reviews.text: Well that lasted a week...... if you have a Harley I don't recommend it a lot of vibration this thing sticks out
customer_reviews.author: TREV594

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE BUYING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Harley softail custom. Worked ok for about two weeks before the ball and stem snapped off on the highway ruining my phone and costing me to replace it. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: jason jackvony

customer_reviews.title: Probably the worst mount in the market
customer_reviews.text: Had great expectations about this mount since, by some strange reason, has great reviews. Only lasted a couple of days! The main hold snapped out dropping my phone to the ground! After contacting the company explaining what happened and how my screen shattered in millions of pieces, the best they could do was to refund me for the faulty mount. They never even offered to replace my screen or phone. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: jmdloco

customer_reviews.title: Decided to continue since the silicon straps would be good enough. The tension knob to tighten the swivel ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and was excited. Before install as I tried to clamp my phone, one of the springs on the clamp fell right off. Tried to reattach the spring to no avail. Decided to continue since the silicon straps would be good enough. The tension knob to tighten the swivel ball couldn't be tightened enough to hold the unit at a specific angle (didn't try any tools at risk of breaking it). It was almost tight but not quite. Went out for a short ride to try it out, and the phone kept swiveling at different angles. Very disappointed. I guess I got what I paid for. :(
customer_reviews.author: Andy K

customer_reviews.title: Do not use
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my Triumph and when I came down the next day it was in pieces. The reason is that I overtightened the clamp. The clamp is metal. The mount is brittle plastic. It doesn't take a genius to figure out what could happen. I didn't lose a phone. Really just out $10. But I'd be furious if this happened on the riad
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: WARNING Faulty Design and Made of Poor Materials
customer_reviews.text: Premium? The bracket sheared at the ball joint while I was riding down the highway on my motorcycle. My phone is now destroyed. I do not recommend buying this bracket if you plan on keeping your phone in one piece. I had to buy a new phone. Update: To be fair, I was reimbursed for the purchase. Unfortunately, I still had to buy a new phone.
customer_reviews.author: C. Monahan

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for holding a phone but I wouldn't put it on a mountain bike.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold my phone while I ride on a trainer. It works fine with both an iPhone 4s and an iPhone 6 Plus, both inside an Otterbox case. The holder clips on to the microphone boom I use when on the trainer and it feels fairly secure. I doubt I will use it outdoors but it looks like it would be OK for road rides on a bicycle. I am not confident it would stand up to use on a motorcycle or a mountain bike. I've been riding indoors because of an injury that has made it difficulty to use one arm. It is difficult to put a phone in the holder without using both hands.
customer_reviews.author: William Renfroe

customer_reviews.title: not for bumpy rides
customer_reviews.text: Used this mount on a hardtail bobber and it worked well for about a week. Attachment to handlebars was very solid, and the rubber part that stretches to hold the phone was excellent. The problem was that the (maybe) half inch ball joint, that attaches the phone holder to the handlebar mount, was not strong enough to handle the bumpy ride and ended up with my cell phone bouncing down the road behind me (luckily my otterbox saved my phone 5 stars!). I guess I should have known better but several reviewers said that they had mounted it securely with no problems to motorcycle handlebars and had no issues. That was not my experience unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Phone holds in place nicely but the swivel is too loose for the type ...
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for hard trail riding. Phone holds in place nicely but the swivel is too loose for the type of riding we do. Spring broke easily on one of our units. Purchased because I read a good review about this product in a biking magazine; however, I am very disappointed it didn't work for mountain biking. Would be a great unit for casual trail riding or roadies though.
customer_reviews.author: Centurion

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Fits solid, no wiggling around. Good strong plastic construction. Very pleased with it. ***Update*** Snapped off at the pivot point. Had potential but broken after only a few months of city and bike path riding. Luckily when it broke it didn't fall all the way off as I was on a bridge over a river. Unpredictable, so I wouldn't trust it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my iPhone secure on my long and sometimes bumpy bike rides
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in March 2019 and use it several times a week on my bike rides, some of which are 30+ miles in length on trails and terrain that definitely jostle me and my bike around. My phone has never fallen out of this holder. Be sure to correctly install and periodically retighten the clamp that goes around your bike handlebars because over time the mounting can come loose a bit. You should check it before every ride. If set up and used correctly, this is a highly secure mount and it does what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Unusable - phone holder droops to the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I put my iPhone 7 on this thing it would droop to the bottom and a little sideways, so it would be facing the ground diagonally. Didn't even take vibration to make it drop, it just couldn't support the weight. No way to adjust the tension of the swivel either. It was still marginally useful for switching songs at lights. For GPS, I'd have to reach out and lift it up to periodically check directions. If I bought it again I'd have to put superglue in the swivel joint at exactly the position I want it in.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: bumpy freeway Okay
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my Ryker ad it was easy to install. I did a aggressive shake test with my cell phone prior to mounting. (shaken not stirred, lol) Then off I went for my ride, I had all kinds of images of my phone flying off, what would I do. So I stayed in the right hand land JUST IN CASE. All was good. Now to get one for my mountain bike. I also like the extra screw and bungies in came with. Use a wrench to tighten the ball joint area once you decide where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: sprtsgirl

customer_reviews.title: I would suggest investing in a better Mount it's not worth losing and expensive phone and ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my motorcycle. I was skeptical because of how the low price was and the reviews. I went on one ride and was gone for a few hours. I checked the mount when I returned home and realized I was one pothole away from losing my phone. I tried to remove my phone and the mount broke off at the handle bar connection. I would suggest investing in a better Mount it's not worth losing and expensive phone and all the headache it brings to get a new one over a $9 mount.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Busch

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good price.
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems good and study. I tried a few different locations before I found one that is comfortable. The good and bad is that it mounts to the handle bars so its always in front of you, but make sure you mount it so that it won't rub the tank or parts of the bike when turning. If not you will scratch the paint and or break the mount. It came with extra web looking holders for the phone and an extra monting screw. Good call by this company. Its always nice to have extra. It stays stable when I'm riding even at 70 MPH and I can still see the GPS on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap but it actually does the job. Holds the phone and it doesn't change position while riding. It has three different settings to attached depending on how thick your handle bars are. This can work pretty much on any bike or motorcycle. Or pretty much anywhere there's a tubular shape. Just make sure everything is tightly fixed. Don't over-tight it, it might brake. UPDATE: Just last night I drove my motorcycle for about 2 hours and when I came back home just noticed I forgot to secure it with the rubber bands. My heart nearly dropped but the phone was still there!!! And I have one of those bulky galaxy note series!! now I'm happiER of this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GeEmWae8

customer_reviews.title: Great for a bicycle and Pokemon Go - probably not for a motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son's mountain bike and so far it works great. I installed it on the handle bars - careful not to over tighten and he has been using it every day. He uses his phone for Pokemon Go and it's safer if he doesn't have to carry it in his hand. Biggest plus - easy to attach and remove phone. If it were a pain he wouldn't use it. It's tough enough or he would have already broken it. I think a motorized device would vibrate too much for this to last.
customer_reviews.author: Pax Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Phones listed is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Says most phones will fit between the clamps, however, I havethe note 8 and it's the same size roughly as the iPhone x, attaching the rubber piece across the back to hold it in its iffy at best. Definitely don't trust the construction enough to use it with my Harley on the highway or even around town... Tried to tighten it federal times and the phone still began to wiggle loose from the vibrations causing it to shift down away from your face
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Would not reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Harley Heritage. Had trouble getting it on the handlebars and getting around the brake and electrical wires. Then after using it three times the expanding arms on the side that keep the phone in broke. They are spring-loaded and the spring came right out. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kody R. Latham

customer_reviews.title: Broke and dropped my Samsung Note 10+ going 25mph on my road bike.
customer_reviews.text: I put on about 2k miles so far this year. Not a ton, but enough apparently to break the plastic off. I know our roads here in Racine and Kenosha are Detroit quality, but I'm disappointed. Luckily, the entire mounting system broke off with it and the phone didn't break. So I guess I have that going for me. UPDATE Bought a second one and it broke after ONE ride. This product is faulty!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design. Cumbersome and fragile mounting system that doesn't work but holds the phone well.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stay upright, doesn't lock in well enough and is an absolute danger to your phone. The mounting system is cumbersome and has too many pieces. you're better off getting one with a belt strap that can be locked in. This falls apart if you try and make it to tight but doesn't stay upright if its too loose. Don't buy if you own a bike that doesn't have a perfectly cylindrical handle bar and even then I wouldn't suggest it because I've tried it on both. The only thing it does right is hold the phone, but if you can't mount it on anything then its a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kocher

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad piece
customer_reviews.text: The unit is easy to mount and holds securely to bars on motorcycle. The back of the cradle is fairly small and while it holds my iPhone 6S I would be more comfortable if a little more of the back of phone was supported. There is nothing wrong with the unit just personal preference would be for a bit more support since it is used on a motorcycle and speeds and vibration could become an issue. I would certainly feel comfortable if it were used on a bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Sodapop

customer_reviews.title: Don’t forget to strap it in
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about this . I just clamped it on and leave it fixed to my bike . Only problem I ever had is twice I forgot to strap in the 4 corners of my phone with the straps that it came with and my phone fell off but that’s my error. When used right, there is no problem . Make sure your phone has a good case and screen protector like I did so if it falls it’s protected.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN G

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but poor mounting - not for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Have had mine mounted on a bicycle for about a year. Mechanism for clamping the phone is quite secure, however the ball and socket that allow the clamp to swivel is not. There is no way to get the socket nut tight enough to prevent movement after hitting a bump. Further, the handle bar clamp is flimsy. You have to walk a fine line between security and broken plastic when mounting. The whole thing is barely okay for a bicycle, but wouldn't last long on a motorcycle. There are much better solutions for that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N

customer_reviews.title: Easy mounting cell phone holder for Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Price and shipping was good, fast and easy. I mounted this on a 2013 H-D Iron 883. Mounting hardware worked perfectly for the handle bar. Install was easy and it appears to be holding tight. The grasp is no different than most cell hone holders, however it came with 4 rubber attachments in different sizes to fit any type of phone. This holds the phone is securely and steady while riding. Hardly any vibration. Now navigation options are as easy on my bike as they are in the car. . I definitely recommend this if you want a handle bar mounting option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope, nope, and barely
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use on anything moving for the number of weak points and rickety construction. It works on my bicycle trainer, which is what I meant it for. Never would this be trusted to hold my phone ($700 computer) on a moving vehicle. It can barely hold the phone on the trainer with slipping about.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I order a ton of stuff from Amazon and almost never leave reviews. I had to leave one for this. The silicone sleeve to hold the phone is rock solid. The first thing I did was strap my phone into the mount and shook it around hard and had no movement. My 77 yamaha vibrates the bars quite a bit and I have no windscreen and this holds. I would use some removable thread lock on the thumb turn bolt thats the only part I could see failing. Your phone is not going anywhere with this. I have a galaxy a51 with a slim case and easily fits.
customer_reviews.author: Kreeg

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised - recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I figured I'd wait until I put some miles on my bike before giving a review. I can say I'm 100% happy. For the price, I just can't argue with anything. It works exactly as advertised. Critically, it keeps my iPhone 7+ firmly attached. I just recently went on a ride where I had to cross a really bumpy wooden bridge. I honestly thought my phone was going to shake loose, but it stayed put. That's when I decided it was time to write the review! :o) Give this a shot ... I suspect you'll be completely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: TedTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I use it but its clunky
customer_reviews.text: At high speeds the ball joint slips and the phone goes from horizontal to angled towards the rider. That doesn't seem to be able to tightened anymore. Also, this adds about 2-3 inches of hight to the handlebars. So, clunky. While the retention is good, I haven't had any issues with the phone falling (I road bike only, mountainbiking should be ok), you miss being able to touch parts of the screen. I'll use this until I can afford an actual bike computer and then my phone will just go in a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Budget Ram Mount (NOT)
customer_reviews.text: ***see update below*** Best bang for your buck out there. I was skeptical at first that such a budget mount could compare to a ram mount. I tested it first with an old phone for about a month on roads ranging from I95 going 85mph to single track trails slamming up and down. The mount works. UPDATE: The mount did not drop my phone BUT it did crack at the base and then broke when I took it off to inspect the crack. It lasted about 4 months. Will update again as to whether or not the company honors the no questions asked lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: After about six months, the springs came off. I spent a couple hours trying to reconnect the springs but couldn't. I continued to use it without the springs using the rubber holder to keep the phone secure. Eventually, the plastic slid off the rail and I just gave up on it. It was good while it lasted. The big X shaped rubber holder made me feel like it wasn't going anywhere. The roads where I live are terrible so bumps are a concern. I didn't want my phone to pop out.
customer_reviews.author: GWS

customer_reviews.title: not quite
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to put this on my motorcycle, but it's not quite what I need. The mounting system is easy enough, but the only place to put it on my handlebar is the near-vertical riser. The swivel doesn't have quite enough range to face the phone toward me, but it was close enough that I thought it might work out. But then there is my phone -- a kyocera duraforce. It has buttons up and down the top and sides. There is no place to put the holder's straps without pushing something. So, I will be looking for another solution.
customer_reviews.author: B. Florence

customer_reviews.title: Secure, clever design from a company that stands by their product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my bicycle to track miles and listen to tunes while I ride. The product is very cleverly designed, with a silicone mesh that holds the phone in place in addition to the spring-loaded clips that squeeze it from the side. The unit comes with two different sizes of silicone mesh, which ensures that your phone will be held securely in place regardless of size. My unit was damaged in shipping (no one's fault in particular) and the company promptly sent a replacement. Great product with an excellent design from a company that cares about a quality product and customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nicodemi

customer_reviews.title: Holds phone securely
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever cellphone mount. My primary concerns were easy and secure mounting of my phone. The stretchy piece definitely holds the phone in place. The swivel mount allows you to position the screen as you wish. I was concerned that the swivel wouldn't be tight enough to hold the desired position while hitting bumps, but it does pretty well. The only question is long term durability of the handlebar and swivel clamps after prolonged UV exposure. So far I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it! Real secure fit.🎯
customer_reviews.text: What I found helpful was how many ways you can use this cellphone holder. (🚴‍♀️🛴🛵🏍☂️⛱, etc.) Anything with a rod. It attatched to my 🚴‍♀️ effortlessly. Easy installation, it comes with 3 flexible bands that are flexible enough to adjust to different size📱. When I made this purchase I was worried that my📱would fall off & get ruined.🤦‍♀️ I spent too much money to loose my Samsung S8 however my worries are gone🤸‍♀️ the 🌞 is shining & I'm on the road 🚵‍♀️ again. As a costumer it's well worth it! I highly recommend... A+ ***Update: Be carefull not to tighten the housing too tightly; it will crack it's made of hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: The Analyst:)

customer_reviews.title: So I was skeptical.... Proven wrong!!  It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this wouldnt work, I thought I would hit a bump and my phone would fall and break. Not a chance!! We ride our bikes nightly and this is great for access to your phone for music, gps, or if your like us, having our phones handy while our son is away and might call. Honestly I havent ridden any trails with this but why would you? If your hitting the trails and jumping etc... you dont want your phone there anyways, that being said it still might not fall off. It is highly secure!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Haskew

customer_reviews.title: The mounting rubber shims desgin could be better
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to keep the rubber shims in place while mounting on the handle bar. Also, in order to get a tight fit, I had to put plastic electrical tape around the handle bar prior to mounting with the rubber shims provided. I could not find a way to get replacement rubber straps for mounting the cell phone to the Roam mount. The rubber straps do not last very long. I hate to have to purchase another Roam mount in order to get the rubber straps. Not good for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Gramps101

customer_reviews.title: Very underwhelmed by this product
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to add this mount to my dual sport. I wound up having to attach it to my mirror, fully expecting it to come loose in this awkward position. The very limited articulation prevented me from placing it in the center of my bars because of the handlebar cross-bar. A longer arm or better articulation may have allowed me to attach it to the handlebar in the center. I should have saved my money on this and paid for a better mount. That being said, it does hold my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit LG G7 ThinQ
customer_reviews.text: Aside from this thing feeling like it came out of a cereal box, it is not good for the LG G7 ThinQ. The side clamp presses the Google assistant button on the left. The only way to avoid that is placing the phone much higher up in the clamp than is safe, in my opinion. Plus, the silicone net thing disallows pressing the bottom two corer soft-keys on the screen. This thing is poorly designed, but perhaps it works fine on other phones. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Used on the bike stem
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my bulky old one and I wanted something with a bigger opening that I can use on my bike stem. - It fit perfectly - feeks solid and trustworthy - looks professional - perfect position in the middle of the handlebars - easy to install - I used it only with the rubber strap, just to be on the safe side - no rattling, no moving, love it :) Hope this helps :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Phone doesn't hold it's position.  That's it's only job, so......
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't keep it's position. Used on a vespa-type scooter. On any road, (slow) street or (fast) highway, the phone would 'sink down' so I couldn't see it. I had to adjust it every couple blocks. Pitched it and bought a RAM Mount. Worlds of difference in terms of staying in position. Beyond that it seems reasonably well built. The screws to hold the back side of the clamp are pretty long, so it's kinda ugly just sticking out there. Seemed to clamp pretty tight. That's about it-
customer_reviews.author: JasonG

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic fell apart on highway
customer_reviews.text: The ball swivel mount is plastic. I had it on a motorcycle behind a windshield. The the ball swivel mount cracked off at 70 mph. Phone hit bike behind me causing damage to guy behind me . Caused me to brake and crash on side of highway when pulling off to retrieve phone . So this cheap mount costed me $$$ to fix friends dented fender. New windshield shifter derby cover and clutch lever. And 250 for insurance for new phone . Big $. Don’t be cheap by a solid phone mount. I learned the hard way . Trust me !
customer_reviews.author: R. SARROCK

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. It feel a little cheap but the phone stays in place pretty well for what this is. While I'm putting the rubber bands around the corners of the phone it feels like the phone is going to fall out unless you have a good grip on it. It attaches to the handle bar easy enough (I believe it's just a plastic wing nut so no need for tools) and it seems to stay put and hold the phone in the orientation without much bounce while riding. All in all I can't say I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your smart phone secure and easy to see
customer_reviews.text: I used this Bike Phone mount to ride 300 miles along the Oregon Coast. I ran my directional map and was able to view directions as I was riding. I kept checking it for security and it remained secure. You do need to be careful to pull the rubber fasteners securely over your phone on all 4 sides because they can slip off. However the rubber holders are there in addition to the arm that holds your phone tight. So it does have a dual holding system. I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very secure cell phone holder. Keeps it still, safe, and secure on motorcycle and moped.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I highly recommend it. Very secure cell phone holder. Keeps it still, safe, and secure on motorcycle and moped. The only negative thing I found is that it is NOT easy to remove and re attach to another moped, motorcycle, or bicycle. Once it is attached it is easier to just leave it on. I really like the fact that it comes with multiple rubber replacement straps. I can see this lasting for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, should have bought one long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to mount and dismount. Very secure on the handle bar. I was concerned that it will dislodge on bumps. No. I have hit many big bumps and it stayed on! Two minor issues. The tie to the handlebar is just a rubber band, it tends to rotate a little. Also if you mount it on a Iphone X or above, it covers the upper cover and renders the widget unusable. Overall good enough for the simplistic and inexpensive approach to mounting.
customer_reviews.author: Doc SikiHi

customer_reviews.title: Mountain Bikers READ THIS
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted for 3 rides. I cant tighten the ball swivel area any more, my phone constantly just flops down since the way you tighten the ball mount is a bad design. My phone sometimes will have a tenancy to want to slide up or down even with the x rubber band in each corner. When you hit a lot of roots that's when the phone mount starts to flop down or forward. If you're a hardcore rider I would not recommend this product, if just an easy going rider or road biker this is a match for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I received the iPhone mount for my bike today. Slightly disappointed that the plastic clamp felt that it could crack in the future although I must add that I have no evidence that it will. However, on the plus side the product has a lifetime warranty, so no worries. I also like that Roam added a spare handlebar screw and 2 extra silicone iPhone holders in case of loss or damage. Installation was super easy, under 2 minutes. Overall I am happy with the product, and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Foo

customer_reviews.title: Broken, Day 1, Before 1st actual ride.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the device and it seemed to fit nicely. Went to remove the phone and the spring loaded clips pulled away from the base, nearly sending my phone to the ground. Never even had a chance to use on the road. Hopefully, this lifetime warranty will cover a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: This it it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a phone mount for your bike, stop browsing, you've found it. I've been using it for a month, it is everything I expected it to be. Installation of the mount was easy, attaching the phone to it is easy too, you can adjust the tilt and once you stop touching it, it doesn't move/tilt/fall. I've even fell from the bike and the phone stayed there waiting for my return. I have a big phone (OnePlus 7+)
customer_reviews.author: Nicolás Buthay

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, unneccesarily complicated design.
customer_reviews.text: This is your basic Made In China plastic item: the plastic is poor quality and the design is equally bad. Too many moving parts made of poor quality materials. The unneccesarily complicated design makes installation a frustrating experience. That, however, is not why I am returning it: I don't trust it to hold my phone in place as I ride a motorcycle over NYC potholes. This plastic novelty item isn't up to the task. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Altfather Good

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. It holds my Samsung Note 8 with an Otterbox case on my 2019 Harley Fat Bob. Hit speeds up to 90 with no problems. Not a lot of bouncing around or rattling. It stayed steady. Don't know how long it will last. The thing is not made of metal. It's all plastic and rubber. curious to see how long that rubber butterfly last. They enclose 2 large rubber replacements and it comes with 1 small one so you get 3 total. You can make the small one work the Note 8. I will follow up
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: It holds the phone, but it looks bad without the phone and the bolts rust
customer_reviews.text: It holds the phone in place. It is bolted in place (vs a detachable RAM mount) and so the flexible part flops around when you ride if there is no phone in the holder. Looks ugly parked, too. I bought it in July and the bolts were rusting by December (I keep the bike outside, with a heavy cover whenever I am not riding). I would go with a ram mount next time and might replace this one while I can still remove the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Staley

customer_reviews.title: Great phone holder on my Harley!
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I could use my I-phone 11 on my 08 Harley-Davidson Fat Bob. Works perfectly even through the vibration test. Easy to see and, even though I’ve only been to and from work with it 16 miles both ways, it seems to hold up well. All plastic but seems to be OK. Good grip on the bars and will fit multiple sizes of bars. The rubber grips hold the phone well and the extra rubber bands sent are pretty tough. I like it, a lot!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Wayne Washington

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit phone with a protective case.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that I cannot use this with my phone with any protective case on the phone. The only way the mount will secure the phone is if the case is taken off, which I am unwilling to do. I think that most people have cases on their phones, so it should be adapted to allow phone cases. Android s10 w/otter case
customer_reviews.author: KoryC

customer_reviews.title: I hit a small bump and my phone popped out and broke on the road
customer_reviews.text: I liked this fine until about my 5th bike ride with it, when the mount came apart at its swivel when I went over a small bump on my bicycle. My smart phone flew off the handlebars with the upper part of the mount and cracked its screen on the pavement. This mount is advertised for use on a motorcycle, so I expected a bit more shock and vibration resistance. This wasn't even on a motorcycle. It was on a bicycle on a paved road. I recommend not buying this mount for any smart phone you wish to keep intact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Phone Mount I've Found
customer_reviews.text: I've had several iPhone bicycle mounts that were either a poor fit for my phones, of questionable design or cheaply made (as in the handlebar mount broke!) The Roam device seems to fit nearly every standard-sized phone and the handlebar gripper is nicely engineered to minimize stress and is built with solid materials. I used it on an hour and a half ride this morning and couldn't be happier. Well done, Roam! The price is right, as well!
customer_reviews.author: David C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: The rubber gasket is fine!
customer_reviews.text: Kinda tricky to mount - there are 3 or 4 different levels to both ends of the clamp mechanism, and at first it might seem too hard to do, but keep at it and you'll get it. Also, there is a rubber gasket-like thing that you use to strap the corners of you phone in, and at first it might seem, with larger phones, that it might be stretched too far and break, but it seems fine on mine (I have a full-size Samsung Galaxy S10 and it fits.
customer_reviews.author: K. P. T.

customer_reviews.title: Scooter and Motorcycle mount
customer_reviews.text: Really great product... came with extra rubber straps and a spare screw to secure it. Very adjustable and I have it currently mounted on my GoTrax scooter and test mounted it to both my motorcycles as well. The clamp fits really nicely on all three. Tension on the arms is good... not too tight but not loose and with the straps on it would take a lot for my phone to go asphalt surfing. Even with the extra strapping it is real easy to mount phone and remove. My iphone 8 fits in it perfectly and it's very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Ken A.

customer_reviews.title: Price for this makes sense, cheap quality and durability.
customer_reviews.text: feels cheap and unsafe. Also in title it says fits iPhone 8plus. The 8plus fits to it constantly wants to hit the off button, volume controls, or vibrate switch. When attempting to contact customer support about everything they were relatively useless and told me to just return thru Amazon. Not really a pleasant experience for such an easy and cheap purchase. Wouldn’t go out of way to return this and repackage it, which was also cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have plenty of exposed handle bar space or it won't mount....
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it would work well. However, unless you have a nice clear wide open space in your handle bars, you'll find it next to impossible to mount. I could not make it work on either my 1977 BMW R100 or my 2006 Suzuki DL650. While I did manage to get it mounted on the DL, there was interference with the tank and my tank bag when turning the bars. So while it's supposedly universal, it's not the universe I ride in.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Good for oversized phones too
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about buying this product at first but I have a friend who just rode round trip across country and used this phone holder for the entire trip. Once I had it installed on my bike I was amazed at how sturdy it kept my phone riding around town. I have an iPhone with an extended battery case and it keeps my phone in place and vibration from my Harley has no affect at all. You get way more than what you pay for and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Emisha Rodriguez Dickey

customer_reviews.title: MOUNTING BRACKET WON'T STAY SECURE.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem is the mounting bracket, that attaches to handle bar won't stay tight. The mount kept slipping down while I have the phone in the bracket. One time when I was riding at high speed, the bracket had twisted completely upside down and my phone came out. Now I've got a cracked screen. I took bracket off and it turns out that the screw was bent. I guess from me tightening it to get a more secure fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tax Man

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic on Handlebar Clamp
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in June of 2019. It worked well for a while, but would occasionally slip and need to be tightened. I only ride three or four times a month max due to having to store my bike at a facility instead of at home; so this holder didn't see much wear. I noticed last night while doing some bike maintenance that it had fallen. But nope! the plastic rings for the metal bar had broken. Thankful I wasn't riding when this happened, or I would be furious.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year, free warranty replacement inbound
customer_reviews.text: I’ve enjoyed this phone mount for about a year. The other day I noticed my phone slipping on every little bump. I figured it must have rattled loose after all that time. Well, the mounting bracket had snapped. I’m not exactly sure how that happened but I contacted Roam, sent a picture and my free replacement is already on its way. I’d rather it didn’t break, but clearly they are standing behind their product and are offering great customer service. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: BLaid

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Yamaha FZ8 Handlebars
customer_reviews.text: For my Yamaha FZ8, there is not enough space for this mount below the handlebar so I had to buy a nut and install it upside down on the bars. I imagine that means this will not fit most standard / naked motorcycles. Other than installation, the build seems to work well, it has been a few months and my phone has not dropped or even been close to dropping out of the mount. It comes with extra mesh holders in case one rips which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It uses a rubber band like strap to secure the phone. Cheap and effective, the draw backs are if you are using headphones, the strap can get in the way, and the strap might be on your volume/power buttons, which means at highway speeds the phone wiggles a little bit, pushing the buttons. The last one isn't a huge issue, just something I noticed can happen. Overall, good product for the financially conscious, does exactly what you want with mild inconveniences.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stipicevic

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity, Security, and Durability
customer_reviews.text: I use this mount for an iPhone 7 Plus on a motorcycle. I've been using the mount daily for a week and a half now. The mount is unprotected on the bike and is very well constructed and durable. It holds the iPhone securely and can be adjusted in all planes. I like the simplicity of the design and it is quick to install and remove the phone when necessary. I highly recommend this phone mount, especially for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Can't miss with this
customer_reviews.text: So my wife has been riding her bike with an arm band because she likes to listen to music. Went for a ride with her and the armband almost fell if like 10 times and became a dangerous hazard, so I popped on to Amazon and bought this. Love it. Had it on the ok in five minutes and it is totally secured. Loved that they sent some extra parts just in case along the way you damage or lose something. My wife wishes we got this years ago as it is so much easier for her now to listen to her music. Great price and product.
customer_reviews.author: William Erario

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my mountain bike to mount the phone on the stem
customer_reviews.text: I mounted it onto the stem of my mountain bike and it holds my iphone 7 securely riding on and off road around the neighborhood with my daughter (so far, I'll get out for a longer ride on a fire road soon and I do not anticipate any issues). The only thing that seems odd, because it is so adjustable with the ball and socket - it is rather tall and the phone is maybe 2-3 inches above the bar it is mounted too. I would love to for it to be flush...but that is not how this one (or any I can find for a stem mount) are designed. It works great and is super adjustable to your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Freakin Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: How crazy is it that I have had a smartphone for 10 years and never thought of using it as a biking computer? I now keep a battery pack in a center frame pouch, run a cable to the phone for long trips, and use this with Map My Ride to bike all over the place without getting lost, tracking my speed, distance, calories, and manliness. Plus, if it ever breaks, the warranty covers it! I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to allow me to use my cellphone as a cycling computer, and later as a dashboard for my electric scooter. It has held every phone I've put in it, but Im pretty sure it wouldn't hold anything as big as a Note or other phablet. I discovered today, upon removing it to clean my scooter, that the mechanism has broken either from the amount of tension necessary to keep it from rotating, or the vibrations from the road over the 150ish miles I've used it. I doubt I will be able to reattach it without first gluing the pieces back together and adding some sort of reinforcement.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Young

customer_reviews.title: Very secure phone mount!
customer_reviews.text: I use this regularly on my 30 mile commute. It's built well, and as long as you use the rubber band on all four corners, your phone isn't going anywhere! I've been using it for a couple years, and I never worry about my phone falling off. A couple months ago I had an 80 mph tank slapper with my phone mounted in this mount. I very nearly came off the bike, and both of my expensive bar end mirrors were hanging limp when I finally regained control. I looked at the handlebars expecting to see my phone had been flung off, but it was still there! The mount didn't move at all! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Bit hard to install on my Motorcycle, but Damn it holds your phone tight!
customer_reviews.text: If you're at all worried about your phone flying out when you're out on the Road with this mount, don't be. It really holds on. I ride a motorcycle, and even flying down a (ahem) "Private Road" at 135mph my phone doesn't budge a bit. Definitely a good grip for your money. If you have an inch and a half of bar space, you can add this thing in without an issue. Just the way my handlebars are on my bike made it slightly harder to install, but once I got the thing screwed in it sticks tight. Definitely recommend this piece.
customer_reviews.author: James Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within a Week, Do Not Trust This To Keep Your Phone Safe
customer_reviews.text: The bike mount Shakes and moves arount a ton during travel. I used it twice, and did not feel safe using it to hold my phone on my motorcycle after i noticed how much movement was going on. 1 day later it fell apart while the bike was parked in the drieway. I was fortunate i was not riding when this happened, or else i wouldnt have a phone anymore. Normally would give 2 stars for just plain bad/cheap products, but leaving 1 star because the poor quality on a cheap product could actually cost future buyers a lot of money in phone replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. The bolts/nuts are not stainless and immediately started rusting. The clamping mechanism did not feel secure on my Pixel 2 phone and would not trust it. The side clamps went directly where my volume buttons were as well. If you have a pixel 2 and value something that won't fall apart, buy something else. I ended up just throwing this away after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schrum

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my Indian Scout. Tried it on both the last and also second to last notch. Both seemed pretty sturdy. I have a huge Samsung Galaxy Note20 Ultra. The rubber straps hold it well. I'm leaning towards the huge phone catching air, but the phone shakes on freeways. This mount is all plastic, so if comparing to the metal others, it doesnt feel "solid." If not comparing to anything else, then it's not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alex a.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful not to overtighten and to place it exactly how you want it to avoid breaking it
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this. It definitely keeps my phone steady, but the mounting system sucks. I tried adjusting it by unscrewing it and the metal screw stripped the plastic where it screws in. Now it doesn’t tighten all the way like it first did and I’ve only had it a couple of weeks. Otherwise? It fits my mini Jetson eBike, so there’s that. It has a lifetime warranty, I think, so if it gets worse, I’ll replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mount for my Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for a while now, maybe one riding season. I had searched high and low for the best product value to hold my phone while I ride my bike. I ultimately chose this product and love it very much. So easy to set up and use and off we go. I like the design and the quality is very good for the right price, good value. I will buy another one for my son when he is ready to ride that way too.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. Cheap plastic and couldnt mount it anywhere. Dont get if you have a motorcycle. Doesnt allow you to angle it. only side to side. Cant see the phone while in the seat. Disappointing!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Achilles heel
customer_reviews.text: This entire mount was rendered useless for want of a tiny unsecured nut on the back of the clamp. It probably would have been less of an issue if I didnt discover the nut that holds the whole thing together was missing literally minutes before leaving on a two week long ride across Japan. It's a nice mount, honestly, but that is a severe design flaw. Glue it in place or better yet mount the fastener.
customer_reviews.author: Chad H

customer_reviews.title: my motorcycle is pretty rough on the vibration
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, very well build, fit my motorcycle, have not try it with the phone on, my motorcycle is pretty rough on the vibration, but it seems solid and the rubber that hold the iPhone 6 should do its job. Like the extra tightening screw and rubber holders for bigger size phone. Let you know in the future, about the durability, because this phone holder will stay on the motorcycle rain or shine.
customer_reviews.author: reza

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I think this is probably the best option on Amazon, I looked through a bunch of different ones.. This one is just fine, however, if you're biking on a rougher trail, not likely your phone stays up where you originally placed it... I have a Galaxy S10+.. every now and then i'll glance down at my phone and it will be tilted down from the weight and bouncy ride... still cool!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clark

customer_reviews.title: Durable, holds over even during the accident
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my motorcycle, a cute little 75 Honda CB200T cruiser. It mounted nicely and securely to my handlebars, my phone never even wiggled. A few weeks ago the bike was totaled after a Ford Ranger hit it and dragged it and my roommate down the road 200 ft while pinned under the truck. His phone stayed secured to the mount and he was able to immediately call me. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone mount
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone mount! I've had it on my motorcycle since I bought it in July and it hasn't failed me once. I've tested it up to about 75-80mph with no trouble, the mount holds my phone very securely. It takes a second to put the phone in, it's not a snap-and-go type mount. Also the web has to be adjusted around my buttons otherwise it holds them down and either locks my phone or increases the volume all the way. But as long as you get the web on securely, your phone is not going to budge, which is the important part.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Porter

customer_reviews.title: Holds phone.
customer_reviews.text: After receiving two emails requesting that I review their product, I am submitting this review. I live in Wisconsin, outdoor biking isn't really an option. So I have a trainer to ride indoors. I was (still am) looking for a phone mount to watch Netflix, listen to music, etc. This would be the sixth product of this type I have purchased. They all have the same issue, they cover the headphone jack. I can't give an honest review, I won't be using it. It does what it says it does. It holds the phone on the handlebars. I gave it one star because of the harassing emails. Otherwise I wouldn't have reviewed it at all.
customer_reviews.author: dave erdmann

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and moves around every time you hit a bump!
customer_reviews.text: At first it looked great, but then I mounted it on a bicycle, put iphone Xs Max in it and took it for a demo ride. The phone was moving around a lot, even with the nut as tight as possible. Maybe because iphone max is pretty big and heavy, or maybe because this mount is not the best quality and doesn't seem to be sturdy. The rubber that holds the corners made me feel like the phone was secured, but then again the whole thing was moving and twisting.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Works better than i thought
customer_reviews.text: Used once on a rough logging road mounted to handle bars. Worked extremely well! It does shake quite a bit but did not move position at all, and i have a heavy Samsung Note 9. Came with extra clamp screw and two extra rubber holding dohickeys. Only thing i would like to see would be a metal clamp instead of a plastic one, but it works so far.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Holds iPhone 8 Plus w/case
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the handle bars of my e-bike (RadRover 2019) and it works great. I go off road and because of the silicone net the phone is very secure. It has never fallen from the mount. I have an Otter Box Defender (very bulky) phone case on this 8 Plus and it works with this mount. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S

customer_reviews.title: Surprise gift for the wife
customer_reviews.text: My wife approved of it. She rides regularly while I work and this allows here to see calls and even have speaker phone conversations if she wishes. Plus, she can run whichever riding app she chooses and keep an eye on progress. It's strong enough, at least when new, to hold a iPhone 7 Plus without the bands over the corners. She'll use them from now on though. All in all an inexpensive win for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rader

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The rubber band fasteners that hold your phone in place are quite flimsy and with road vibration and the like while riding a motorcycle I wouldn’t trust them to not break... they do include several replacement rubber bands but that is kind of akin to closing the barn door after the horse has escaped... I wouldn’t risk this system while riding my bike at 70mph on a freeway.. $1000 phone smashed to pieces? Nope
customer_reviews.author: Jon Keagle

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my motorcycle. Install was super easy. Just unloosen the clamp then tighten it securely back on.. Super easy. I have something similar to ape hangers only they are baby apes....so I positioned the mount on the side. Looks great. I tested the mount and it is very stable regarding vibration while idling and no vibration whatsoever when moving. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy - easy to install, working great
customer_reviews.text: Note - the "1" reviews all seem to be motorcycles - maybe it's best to limit its installation to bicycles. Installed literally in seconds and it's very easy to put the phone on and take it off each time. Phone stays secure during the ride and you can tilt it up down and left right for best viewing angle. I love having the phone with mapmyride showing while I pedal along. While driving on the expressway, I noticed something flapping in the rear window on my rear-mounted bike - it was the rubber corner holders of the phone holder. I feared it was ruined, but it was not - the highway speed flapping did no harm - still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: eddie the geek

customer_reviews.title: Great mount, nice design.
customer_reviews.text: This mount was easy to install, and it came with several different sizes of mounting options to facilitate different sizes of devices and mounting locations. Once attached, my iPhone 7S Plus did not budge, which made me feel a lot more comfortable that my phone was not going to pop off during a bumpy ride or jump. It was a tad bit tricky to get used to putting the phone on and I did not see any directions come with this item (which not only might have been accidentally omitted, but would barely have been needed because of an intuitive design.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: No wobble
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that when you get up to higher speeds on the freeway that this would have a bad wobble. I took it out yesterday and got up in the 80-85mph range, and it was totally secure and stable. I'd buy it again if I needed to, but it seems to be good enough quality that I'm betting it will last a long time. Install was easy and took maybe 5 minutes. I'd recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It fell off my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: The product fell of my motorcycle after a few weeks of use. The tightening mechanism is a twisting knob. It loosens on the vibration of the motorcycle engine. I have to constantly tighten it to the handlebar. I forgot one day and it simply fell off along with my phone. Fortunately, my phone case protected my device. I would not trust or buy this phone holder
customer_reviews.author: K. Vu
